structured.description: A `CorsConfig` class that configures CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) settings for a Spring MVC web application. The configuration adds CORS mappings for all URLs and allows requests from any origin, as well as specifying which HTTP methods, headers, and credentials are allowed.

items.description: Is used to configure CORS settings for a Spring Web MVC application. The class contains a @Value annotation to retrieve a value from a properties file, and a @Bean annotation to create a new instance of a WebMvcConfigurer interface. The interface provides methods for adding CORS mappings to the registry, allowing origins, methods, headers, and credentials.
items.name: CorsConfig

items.description: Configures CORS settings for a web application, allowing cross-origin resource sharing from specified origins and methods, and exposing specific headers.

returns.description:
a configuration for CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) that allows cross-origin requests from specified origins and methods, and exposes specific headers.

* `allowedOrigins`: An array of allowed origins for CORS requests.
* `allowedMethods`: An array of allowed HTTP methods for CORS requests.
* `allowedHeaders`: An array of allowed headers for CORS requests.
* `exposedHeaders`: An array of exposed headers for CORS requests.
* `allowCredentials`: A boolean value indicating whether credentials (e.g., cookies, authorization headers) are allowed or not in CORS responses.

items.name: corsConfigurer

items.description: Adds CORS mappings to a registry, allowing requests from any origin and specifying allowed methods, headers, and credentials.

params.name: registry
params.description: CorsRegistry object that contains the mapping configuration for handling Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) requests.

items.name: addCorsMappings
